title: How have we gained more knowledge than previous generations, but continue to make mistakes like the older generations? - Quora

response.answer_text: A bit of a dichotomy. We haven’t gained more knowledge, we just have easier access. “Information is like garbage, you had better know what you’re going to do with it before you collect it.” Attributed to Mark Twain. If you buy the more than 100 hammers (gained more), available at the big fix-it stores, doesn’t guarantee you will hit a nail better. They have specific reasons for being different. Learning and modeling the thought process can be helpful. Learning what not to do is also helpful. Learning what has worked somewhere else can be helpful. But this means an investment in time. Or communicating with others trying to solve the same problem.

No one wants to take personal responsibility and as a result nor does the entire world. If your question doesn’t clearly indicate that this is indeed the case and not a matter of who has more bling then what could possibly? Technological advancement comes from demand that had always depended on short-term wants of the customer. It seems so hard to believe that people actually make the world the way it is that they will blame the illuminati, the politicians, religions, anyone at all but themselves and thus voluntarily give up control over their life/their power to choose. People put themselves into a circle and fail to recognize it so guess what happens if no one wants to stop for a minute to think and be rational - mistakes get repeated.

Because we always gain some knowledge, not all knowledge. We interpret facts by modern standards and not by time-of-happening historical standards. Moreover, valueable knowledge is hidden from modern societies. Like there is a plan to make modern generations copycat robots rather than free thinkers.

Humans have gained more immediate access to knowledge, but that doesn’t mean humans are any smarter. In fact, a case could be made that, with information so readily available, nobody really needs to learn how to do anything. Plus, it allows contemporary humans to make mistakes of which older generations were entirely unaware.

Vanity. We refuse to learn the lessons of history. Every generation thinks it’s the first to experience the world’s challenges, and thinks it has to find brand new “solutions” to age-old problems, including problems that have been solved effectively (although not perfectly) in the past. It comes down to shortsightedness and hubris. Every generation thinks they’re wiser than the one before.

We have to take time to remember I all ways. Why is it two people look at the same thing and one says look at that and all of a sudden it becomes clear. A forgotten memory emerges. It is not just the mind sense. Blockages occur because of our prejudices. We have to throw away our old clothes. Does our body regulate,our emotions or the mind. Who are we when. Where does the memory emerge from.

Only very few will gain much knowledge, rest will live in happily ignorance, besides most can only “parrot” knowledge, not really understand how to use it wisely. If you know what is right and wrong, many will choose the wrong like smoking, drinking, eat sugar and overeating, etc because of cravings, compulsions, group pressure. etc etc.
